data.title: Inside Maryland Sports Radio
data.text:
In the third part of his five-part series naming Maryland football's all-time team, Ralph Friedgen ranks the Terps' best defensive and offensive linemen of all-time and dished previously untold stories to IMS Radio's Larry France about:

Which player was upset about his position change, but ended up becoming an NFL star at his new position?

Who is the best football player Freidgen has ever seen or been associated with?

Which player punched Friedgen in the face?

Which offensive lineman was the ACC Player of the Year?

Which player caused Navy to vow to never play Maryland again?

Which player was Gloria Friedgen's favorite player?

Why did Freidgen kiss Debbie Yow?

Which player had a softball-sized tumor removed from his chest and went on to become an All American?

Which player did Friedgen do an in-home recruiting trip after he'd been fired and get to commit to Maryland?

Under which coach did the players have a revolt?

Watch here on YouTube, or listen to the podcast.

Get your Maryland men's basketball season tickets and football season tickets and save money with limited-time promos!

-- Want the latest Terps news delivered to your inbox FREE? Sign up for our email newsletter here and stay informed on Maryland basketball, football, recruiting and every other Terps storyline. And make sure to follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Tiktok and Instagram!

-- Don't miss any of our new video Terps content: Subscribe to InsideMDSports on YouTube and hit the notification bell so you know when new videos drop.

-- Need a go-to Terps podcast? Listen to IMS Radio here, watch earlier episodes here and don't forget to subscribe to IMS Radio on iTunes | Spotify | Stitcher | Podbean | Amazon Music | TuneIn | Apple Podcasts

In the final episode of Ralph Friedgen's all-time Maryland football team, the former coach picks his top Terps coaches and special teamers. The Friedge also opened up on:

The craziest story of the entire series at the end of the episode. A must-hear story.

What is Ralph’s forecast for Mike Locksley’s future at Maryland?

Would Bobby Ross and Ralph Friedgen have stayed at Maryland if not for the sanctions?

Who called the play on the conference-clinching TD catch against NC State in 2001?

What’s the difference between a kickoff returner and a punt returner?

Where does Friedgen rank in the all-time coaches list?

Which player changed his uniform number based on the number of points he'd scored on the season?

To learn more about listener data and our privacy practices visit: https://www.audacyinc.com/privacy-policy

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit https://podcastchoices.com/adchoices

In the latest episode of Ralph Friedgen's All-Maryland Football Team, the former Terps coach named Maryland's all-time best players at linebacker and dished to IMS Radio's Larry France on:

Which future 3-time All-ACC player was originally committed to Maryland under Ron Vanderlinden, and had to be convinced to stick with the commitment by Friedgen?

Which player is the one who tackled Bo Jackson and gave him the infamous hip injury that derailed his career?

Which two-time 1st team All ACC player did a great Chuck Berry impersonation?

Which player paid his way to Maryland as a transfer but had a scholarship offer by the end of the fifth spring practice?

Which player was kicked off the team, came back as a walk on, and went on the NFL?

Which player’s mom was a student at Maryland the same time as the player?

Which player argued with Friedgen about his position but ended up as an NFL All-Pro after agreeing to a switch?

To learn more about listener data and our privacy practices visit: https://www.audacyinc.com/privacy-policy

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit https://podcastchoices.com/adchoices

In the second edition (watch here) of IMS Radio's five-part series with former Terps football coach Ralph Friedgen, the Fridge picked the best receivers and tight ends in Maryland football history.

(Episode One: Friedgen picks the QBs and RBs)

He also dished on a variety of subjects and shared previously untold stories about:

An all-time great who broke his leg in his senior year of High School or may not have ended up at Maryland.

A 90’s era Terp who Friedgen scouted when he was with the San Diego Chargers.

A player that Friedgen recruited to Rutgers but he came to Maryland.

Who was the fastest WR Friedgen ever coached?

Which famous broadcaster was in Ralph Friedgen’s golf foursome and convinced him to bring Darryl Hill back to MD as a motivational speaker and fund raiser?

Which player used to get water thrown on him in high school by the girls so he’d have to take his shirt off?

Which highly rated brothers who went to another school would Friedgen have gotten to Maryland had he not been fired?

To learn more about listener data and our privacy practices visit: https://www.audacyinc.com/privacy-policy

Learn more about your ad choices. Visit https://podcastchoices.com/adchoices

Larry France introduced a special new series from IMS Radio this week. Hardcore Maryland football fans will love every minute.

"Welcome to a very special episode of IMS Radio, one of my most favorite things we've ever done with IMS Radio," he said. "We're going to be doing the all-time Maryland Terrapins football team, and who better to do that with than coach Ralph Friedgen?"

Friedgen, one of the most successful coaches in Maryland football history, spent hours with France to produce a five-part series that will run on Monday and Thursday this week and next, followed by the finale the following Monday.

France: "I decided I wanted to do this project a little while ago and I spent three to four weeks collecting data, going everywhere I could over the Internet,UMTerps.com, College Football Reference and and I asked coach, would you be willing to do this with me? And unbelievably, you said yes. And not only did you say yes, you said, 'If we're going to do this, we're going to do it right.' And so we have spent a lot of time going through the data, analyzing, moving people around and it's been a lot of fun."

On several occasions, Friedgen doubled back and changed a selection because he'd thought of another more deserving player. He played at Maryland and coached the Terps to their best run ever, three straight 10-win seasons in the early 2000s.

"You know, Larry, it's never gonna be easy. It's never gonna be [with] so many good players. Especially when you're considering different eras and different styles of football and different players, so we did the best we could.

In the first installment (watch on YouTube), Friedgen picks the top quarterbacks and running backs in Maryland football history.
